acceptedAnswer.text: Our simulators use the official 2026 tax brackets published by French and Moroccan tax authorities. However, they provide estimates and do not replace personalized tax advice.
No. All calculations are performed locally in your browser. No personal data is sent to our servers or stored.

mainEntity.name: How is net salary calculated in France?

acceptedAnswer.text: Net salary is obtained by deducting employee social contributions from gross salary (about 22% for non-executives, 25% for executives). These contributions fund social security, retirement, unemployment, and supplementary retirement.

The family quotient is a mechanism that divides taxable income by the number of shares in the household. A single person has 1 share, a married couple 2 shares, and children add additional half-shares.

mainEntity.name: What are the IR brackets in Morocco?

acceptedAnswer.text: Moroccan IR has 6 progressive brackets: 0% up to 40,000 MAD, 10% from 40,001 to 60,000 MAD, 20% from 60,001 to 80,000 MAD, 30% from 80,001 to 100,000 MAD, 34% from 100,001 to 180,000 MAD, and 37% beyond.

CNSS (National Social Security Fund) covers family benefits, health, and retirement. The employee rate is 4.48%, capped at 6,000 MAD/month. AMO (Mandatory Health Insurance) covers healthcare costs at 2.26% without cap.

acceptedAnswer.text: Nos simulateurs utilisent les baremes officiels 2026 publies par les administrations fiscales francaise et marocaine. Cependant, ils fournissent une estimation et ne remplacent pas un conseil fiscal personnalise.
Non. Tous les calculs sont effectues localement dans votre navigateur. Aucune donnee personnelle n'est envoyee a nos serveurs ni stockee.

mainEntity.name: Comment est calcule le salaire net en France ?

acceptedAnswer.text: Le salaire net est obtenu en deduisant du brut les cotisations sociales salariales (environ 22% pour les non-cadres, 25% pour les cadres). Ces cotisations financent la securite sociale, la retraite, le chomage et la retraite complementaire.

Le quotient familial est un mecanisme qui divise le revenu imposable par le nombre de parts du foyer fiscal. Un celibataire a 1 part, un couple marie 2 parts, et les enfants ajoutent des demi-parts supplementaires.

mainEntity.name: Quelles sont les tranches d'IR au Maroc ?

acceptedAnswer.text: L'IR marocain comporte 6 tranches progressives : 0% jusqu'a 40 000 DH, 10% de 40 001 a 60 000 DH, 20% de 60 001 a 80 000 DH, 30% de 80 001 a 100 000 DH, 34% de 100 001 a 180 000 DH, et 37% au-dela.

mainEntity.name: Qu'est-ce que la CNSS et l'AMO ?

acceptedAnswer.text: La CNSS (Caisse Nationale de Securite Sociale) couvre les prestations familiales, maladie et retraite. Le taux salarial est de 4.48%, plafonne a 6 000 DH/mois. L'AMO (Assurance Maladie Obligatoire) couvre les frais de sante au taux de 2.26% sans plafond.
